author: tosidrop
title: TosiDrop DAO Governance Platform
description: DAOs rely on a governance and voting mechanism to allow community members to contribute to the direction of a protocol. TosiDrop is implementing a seamless on-chain voting mechanism.

f6_assessments.q0: TosiDrop is adding an on-chain voting mechanism to their token distribution platform. I think that DAOs will be an important part of the next blockchain adoption cycle and governance tools are very much needed on Cardano, however, this proposal is limited to voting and doesn't include treasury management using smart contracts. TosiDrop is on Ergo and Cardano, and this added functionality will help strengthen the bridge between both communities. The cTOSI token is going to be 90% distributed to the public, so I'm happy to support community projects.
f6_assessments.q1: Tosidrop has successfully launched their token claiming machine on mainnet. They have a very strong team with a proven track record. Tosidrop is from the team which is building anetaBTC on Cardano and Ergo. The team has shown innovation on the Ergo blockchain by doing the largest airdrop to 20k wallets. I'm confident they can deliver on this proposal. Clear roadmap to completion.
f6_assessments.q2: There are clear milestones which can be measured during development. What KPIs can be used to measure the success of the completed project, such as number of votes or number of projects using the voting mechanism?

f6_assessments.q0: While the general description of the deliverable is clear and while having a good on-chain voting experience will surely be beneficial, the proposers don't manage to bring along the uniqueness of their concept, as there already are open source coded concepts of on-chain voting tools. No KPIs are mentioned. The deliverable should be scalable and I see no reason why it shouldn't be aligned with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no real explanation of the Budget other than monthly rates (try adding some hours to each task), and the implementation plan is, as also mentioned in the auditability section, quite top-level and could be more detailed. Like formulating concrete, actionable tasks. It can be seen that the team consists of some stakepool operators and has generated a faucet where SPOs can provide incentives for staking with their pools. While this is something that could easily be made based on other Open Source scripts, the implementation clearly shows some skills. There have however only been shared some handles of the team members and not much more info. Some kind of risk discussion has been done but no real mitigation strategy provided. The github shows some coding skills.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap has been provided. It could be a bit more descriptive as it only mentions top-level deliverables and not the single steps to implement them. The problem description is comprehensible along with the solution to it described, so the main deliverables should be clear and auditable. The Github presented is an additional opportunity for auditability. Some KPIs would have gone quite well along with it.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge on DAO operation and governance. The team’s proposal on how the governance in Cardano and Ergo blockchain could be improved by using their cTOSI and eTOSI tokens for other projects to vote using their platform. This is a brilliant idea for the use case of the TOSI tokens use as voting. However, I believe for majority of projects (DAOs, PFPs & Metaverses) that have their own fungible tokens, the TosiDrop platform could integrate using their fungible tokens to vote as many DAOs, PFPs and Metaverse projects have their fungible tokens as governance tokens. Thus, increasing more utility of the TosiDrop platform as this is a one-stop platform for voting and governance. The TOSI team can earn revenue from charging slight fees as stated in their proposal. Since this platform can be connected to any Cardano & Ergo wallets around the world, this project can slowly scale globally. The team have stated the risk of running out of funds to complete the project. However, I believe the main risk is the security of the smart contracts they build on Cardano and Ergo. There were many hacks happening in the Ethereum, Binance and Solana blockchains, it is important to have solid security on the platform’s smart contracts for people to trust using this platform.
f6_assessments.q1: The team of developers are from Cardano SPOs who have been supporting and building on the Cardano ecosystem. They have the relevant experience to build for the Cardano and Ergo blockchains. However, they did not provide their full profile details of experience which makes it difficult to properly evaluate this proposal. The project timeline seems reasonable and achievable as the team have related experiences to execute this project. However, there is some confusion with the project timeline and the requested budget. The project timeline is from Q3 2022 to Q3 2023 (about 12 months), but the requested budget is for 5 months only. Another confusion is they have a team of 8 which require $2,000/month (which will be $80,000 for 5 months), but the team requested a budget of $70,000. The budget requested is considered high because the team is also working on other projects and not enough budget breakdown such as how many hours per week in a month to justify the $2,000/month for 5 months or 12 months period, which affects the scoring for this section. Since the team is also working on other projects, there could be delay delivering this project. Due to the confusion between the timeline and budget, it is difficult to justify the success of this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The team have provided very little details to audit them. Suggestions for the team to be better audited by the community are 1) metric for number of projects used their platform for voting using TOSI tokens. Will be better if the team integrate for other projects to use their own fungible tokens to vote in Tosi platform 2) no. of wallets voting from their platform 3) no. of return projects, users/wallets using their platform 4) open source their coding and documents in github and/or google sheets and updating them constantly (the team already have a github) 5) having third parties to audit their smart contracts for security purpose 6) provide updates to the community weekly/bi-weekly/monthly on the progress of the development of their project with data via Twitter spaces, Youtube videos, Twitter or Discord announcements 7) engagement and activity between the team and the Cardano and Ergo communities.

f6_assessments.q0:
TosiDrop is a community token distribution platform that allows anyone to distribute efficiently the tokens based on any criteria. 
In addition to the airdropping of tokens and providing incentives to SPO to allow additional rewards from staking. The TosiDrop platforms aims to increase the cardano decentralization by avoiding larger ISPO and large accumulation of stake with multi pool operators. 
The Tosi token has been created and is being airdropped now to over 20,000 unique wallets based on cNeta staking and other supporting activities. 
The proposal is for TosiDrop to use this token as a DAO voting mechanism to provide each holder eallet to register their preference and engage the community. 
This will add further the decentralization  of this platform.
f6_assessments.q1:
Tosidrop has presented a total of 3 project for fund9. Although each project will bring forward a unique addition or improvement. I feel it is important to state as part of this assessment. 
Equally the team is also well accomplished and have been part of the cardano ecosystem. The developers such a ada seal and others are well known and have brought to the community some essential tools. 
I do have great confidence in their capabilities and motivation to create a successful DAO for TosiDrop. 

The timeline and budget is mainly focused on développer cost which is ma hours to build the smart contract and DAO voting mechanism. 
The challenge is to balance the core teams priorities based on the number of successful proposal acceptance (3 submitted) 
Finally the cost of the programming manhours is on the higher side compared to the other proposals reviewed. However this may ba attributed to the high level of technical skills required.
f6_assessments.q2:
Similarly to the other proposals many of the milestones listed for this project will be made public. The large community participating in TosiDrop and pulling token distribution every epoch will be a great indicator of the success of this project. 
I am wondering on the tokenomics of the Tosi distribution as if it was unfairly distributors the DAO will be skewed and unfairly advantage certain groups. 
This may need to be clarified to the community to ensure safe and clear practices. 
I would also indicate that similar DAO systems are being created in the space (drip drops) and the results of the DAO was long and unclear.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has a very clear challenge. This helps the proposers to understand exactly what the proposal is intended for. I would agree that a DAO Governance Platform in Tosidrop would be huge. The project already has a healthy ecosystem and lots of people that are big followers of the project. The proposal describes how they were able to airdrop Tosi tokens to lots of early supporters of their project. With a large distribution of their tokens to lots of different people, it creates a great community where a DAO would be extremely important. This gives all users of Tosi the opportunity to vote, and it promotes decentralization. I believe that this proposal addresses their challenge accurately, and that there is a lot of good that can come from a DAO in this project. For these reasons, I give this section 5 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is very experienced and is already a big part of the early Cardano ecosystem. They have lots of followers and have been trustworthy thus far. There is a highly detailed roadmap that addresses all the things they have already accomplished, and the things they plan to accomplish in the future. This is important because it allows us as proposers to understand what we can expect from this project and proposal if they receive funding. There is a high likelihood that this proposal will be implemented successfully because there is a lot of information that is detailed very precisely. They have a huge community that will help them to stay accountable as they commence building their Governance Platform. For these reasons, I give this section 5 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: I enjoyed reading through this proposal and I find that the information provided is very sufficient to monitor the success of this proposal. The detailed budget breakdown is an important part of the proposal that can help us determine if this proposal should be funded or not. In this example, this proposal has a very descriptive review of where all of the funds will go and how that will be necessary for the building of the DAO. In their description it shows that it will take around 5 months to complete. A timeline is also very important because it gives the project a deadline. Sure this can be changed, but this will influence the team to make sure it gets done because they will have their community and others helping them to stay accountable. This increases the likelihood of this proposal to be successful and them to follow-through with their intention to create a DAO Governance Platform in this case. For these reasons, I give this section 5 out of 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: I see that this proposal addresses the challenge by providing a platform as a DAO infrastructure. Proposer already has an initial platform that functions as a token distribution under the name TosiDrop and will make it an all-in-one platform including DAO. What makes it even more interesting is that the platform created will run on 2 blockchains namely Cardano and Ergo and the proposer is very confident that the risks that may arise will be solved properly based on experience in making software that runs on Cardano and Ergo. The platform created later will certainly provide benefits to the cardano community in collaborating on a project and distributing its tokens if any.
f6_assessments.q1: The timeline shown by the proposer is very clear with every step in realizing this DAO platform. With the current number of teams, they will be given a salary to focus on doing their work according to the specified time, of course, the amount of funds requested is appropriate. But as usual if I do an assessment, of course I want to see further the expertise of the team so it would be better if the entire team per member was given a url for example on their linkedin or github. Although I believe that this team is experienced because I myself have tried TosiDrop in general to claim tokens. So if this proposal gets funding or not, we still need to pay attention so that this platform can be realized with the help of the community.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap or timeline shown can be a benchmark for conducting audits according to the targets they plan to complete. A platform that is created as an all-in-one that functions as a DAO as well as token distribution is certainly very interesting. The claim token platform is already available where we can see its progress directly and monitor developments according to the roadmap. A github link is also available for all of us to see how the developer works.

solution: Through TosiDrop, projects are able to implement votes to decide on the direction of a project. On-chain voting will allow projects to seamlessly host governance events.
experience: Our team has been developing on-chain infrastructure on Cardano since 2018 and we have already deployed our claiming vending machine on Cardano's mainnet. We have the skills and experience required to integrate voting/governance on our platform in a seamless manner.
